intro: Truellum strigosum, commonly known as the hairy truellum, is a herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, hairy texture, giving it its common name. Its flowers are white or pale pink and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Truellum strigosum is often found in association with other moisture-loving plants in its native habitat.
